subject: Business
title: Decision-Making Under Uncertainty
description: A short lesson to help you apply Decision-Making Under Uncertainty.

hook.text: Jeff Bezos says most decisions should be made with about 70% of the information. Wait for 90% and you're too slow.

buildup.text: Uncertainty is the default state for leaders. Perfect information never arrives in time.

discovery.text: Bezos distinguishes 'one-way doors' (irreversible) from 'two-way doors' (reversible). Only the first need caution.

twist.text: Analysis paralysis costs more than wrong decisions. A good decision made quickly beats a perfect decision made late.

climax.text: Amazon's bias for action over perfection drove its expansion from books to everything.

punchline.text: Decide fast on reversible choices. Decide carefully on permanent ones.

quiz.question: What is Bezos's framework for decision speed?
options: Decide fast on reversible 'two-way door' decisions; be careful with irreversible 'one-way doors'
Always wait for 100% of the information
Delegate all decisions to avoid personal risk
